DOC.brief_title: Dexmedetomidine Long-term Outcome Elderly Patients After Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: Delirium frequent postoperative complication ; systematic review reveal postoperative delirium occur 36.8 % surgical patient , prevalence increase age . The occurrence delirium associate bad long-term outcome include bad functional recovery , decline cognitive function , increase mortality rate . Surgical stress , pain , sleep disturbance important factor lead postoperative delirium elderly . Dexmedetomidine highly selective alpha-2 adrenoreceptor agonist provide anti-anxiety , sedation , modest analgesia minimal respiratory depression . For mechanically ventilate intensive care unit ( ICU ) patient , dexmedetomidine sedation improve quality sleep , decrease incidence delirium , shorten duration ICU stay . For patient undergo surgery , perioperative dexmedetomidine relieve severity stress response , decrease requirement anesthetic , improves postoperative analgesia . In previous stage current study , 700 elderly patient admit ICU noncardiac surgery recruit randomize two group ( dexmedetomidine group placebo [ normal saline ] group ) . The result show prophylactic low-dose dexmedetomidine infusion early postoperative period ameliorate subjective sleep quality decrease incidence delirium ( 22.6 % [ 79/350 ] placebo vs. 9.1 % [ 32/350 ] dexmedetomidine ; Odds Ratio 0.35 , 95 % Confidence Interval 0.22 0.54 ; p < 0.0001 ) . The investigator hypothesize low-dose dexmedetomidine infusion may also improve long-term outcome patient population . The purpose 3-year follow-up study evaluate whether prophylactic low-dose dexmedetomidine infusion early postoperative period improve 3-year outcome elderly patient recruit previous randomize controlled trial .
DOC.criteria: Patients include meet follow criterion : 1 . Age 65 year old ; 2 . Underwent elective noncardiac surgery general anesthesia ; 3 . Admitted ICU surgery . Patients exclude meet follow criterion : 1 . Preoperative history schizophrenia , epilepsy , Parkinsonism myasthenia gravis ; 2 . Inability communicate preoperative period ( coma , profound dementia language barrier ) ; 3 . Brain injury neurosurgery ; 4 . Preoperative leave ventricular ejection fraction < 30 % , sick sinus syndrome , severe sinus bradycardia ( < 50 beat per minute ) , seconddegree great atrioventricular block without pacemaker ; 5 . Serious hepatic dysfunction ( ChildPugh class C ) ; 6 . Serious renal dysfunction ( undergoing dialysis surgery ) ; 7 . Unlikely survive 24 hour .
